text:
Does anyone know why this error popups using a simple `if` statement?
```    println(integrator.p.位[5])
    println(H(fvp[5] - u[10]))
    if H(fvp[5] - u[10]) == 0 && (integrator.p.位[5] > 0)
        println("ag 5, max reached, time $t")
        return true
    end
>>     
20.0
1
ERROR: TypeError: non-boolean (Nothing) used in boolean context```

elements.text: Does anyone know why this error popups using a simple

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

The problem is the `H(...)` part. The definition of `H` is very simple
```H(x) = x <= 0 ? 0 : 1 ```
so it always returns an integer, so where is the `Nothing` coming from

elements.text: so it always returns an integer, so where is the

text: Oh nevermind, it wasn't my `if` statement, but something downstream in the ODE package.
